importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: Kada Scott was last seen at her workplace on the night of October 4, 2025, which marks the starting point of the investigation into her disappearance.
On October 19, 2025, human remains were found in a shallow grave, and a man named Keon King was arrested and charged with Scott's kidnapping, marking a major development in the case.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The time frame of Scott's last known activity, when she left her workplace and disconnected from all communication, is central to understanding the timeline of her disappearance and the investigation's focus on tracking her movements.
The two-week period between October 4 and October 19 is significant as it encompasses the entire span of the investigation and the eventual discovery of human remains.

keyTakeAways: A 23-year-old Philadelphia woman, Kada Scott, went missing after being last seen at her workplace on October 4, 2025.
Human remains of an unidentified female were found in a shallow grave behind an abandoned school in a heavily wooded area two weeks after her disappearance.
Suspect Keon King, 21, was arrested and charged with Scott’s kidnapping and with a prior kidnapping case involving a domestic assault and strangulation, indicating a possible pattern of behavior.
King is believed to be the last person in contact with Scott, and police tracked him using phone communication data, which led to his arrest.
A specific anonymous tip led investigators to the shallow grave where the remains were discovered, highlighting the critical role of public input in solving the case.
The same vehicle (a gold 1999 Toyota Camry) linked to King was reportedly found in an apartment complex parking lot after a public tip, suggesting possible involvement in Scott’s disappearance.
The Philadelphia Police Department and FBI’s Violent Crime Task Force are jointly investigating the case, emphasizing the seriousness and complexity of the incident.
Scott’s family, particularly her mother and father, have expressed deep anguish and a desperate need for answers, urging the public to come forward with any information.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Two weeks after 23-year-old Philadelphia woman Kada Scott went missing, human remains were discovered in a shallow grave behind an abandoned school. Police believe the suspect, 21-year-old Keon King, was the last person in contact with her and is charged with her kidnapping, as well as a prior domestic kidnapping case. Investigators used phone tracking and a public tip to identify King and locate the grave. A gold 1999 Toyota Camry linked to King was also found after another public tip, suggesting possible involvement in Scott’s disappearance. The case is being jointly investigated by the Philadelphia Police Department and the FBI’s Violent Crime Task Force. Scott’s family, especially her parents, have expressed deep anguish and are urging the public to come forward with any information. The discovery of the remains and the pattern of behavior in King’s prior case raise serious concerns about a possible criminal pattern.
title: Police Investigating Disappearance of Philadelphia Woman Say Tip Led Them to Shallow Grave With Human Remains
